snippet: Shirley L. Huntley of Queens, who is awaiting sentencing on a related federal charge, admitted in state court to trying to cover up the theft.
abstract: Shirley L Huntley, former state senator from Queens, pleads guilty to falsifying evidence in attempt to cover up theft of taxpayer money from nonprofit agency she founded, ending prominent corruption case that included charges in federal and state courts; faces up to two years in prison when she is sentenced on April 4.
lead_paragraph: Shirley L. Huntley of Queens, who is awaiting sentencing on a related federal charge, admitted in state court to trying to cover up the theft.

headline.seo: Ex-Senator Shirley Huntley Pleads Guilty in 2nd Fraud Case
headline.main: Ex-State Senator Files 2nd Guilty Plea in Fraud
headline.print_headline: Ex-State Senator Offers 2nd Guilty Plea in Fraud
